data.title: Move audio loaders from engine to mod level
data.body:
There wasn't anything significant blocking this move, so audio loaders now follow sprite loaders.

Bag loading of wav/ima in RA2 needs to be tested, just in case. 
cc @GraionDilach @abcdefg30 @Mailaender

data.title: Ore trucks look up for ore indefinitely in only one direction
data.body:
Release 20160508.
I created a custom map with this configuration, **no ore and no ore mine**.
The ore truck starts from the refinery and goes to the bottom left of the map (until it reaches it) in order to find ore.
If it encounters an obstacle it comes back and retries forever.
The short lags are due to "Pathfinder" and "tick_activities" pikes.
![harvester infinite loop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/16283570/945fe56a-38cd-11e6-9d6d-53ceeba3d0d8.gif)

It could stop searching after a while or try another direction.

data.title: Engineers don't want to move to the unload area of the allied refineries
data.body:
Release 20160508.
With the Alt key pressed I can't ask my engineer to move there, I get the repair cursor instead.

![insubordination](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/16282700/2f639038-38ca-11e6-93ba-a183d61e33d4.png)
![insubordination2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/16282799/8f16b820-38ca-11e6-83d6-aa528e6940aa.png)

If the refinery is damaged I also have the repair cursor, even with the Alt key pressed.

![insubordination3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/16282949/219e50f4-38cb-11e6-9a63-92970cbb77c5.png)

data.title: Add support for a non-proprietary OpenRA SHP format
data.body:
While I couldn't find anything conclusive about the legal status of TD/RA SHP compression algorithms (though any patents covering them should have expired by now), at least the RLE zeros compression used by SHP(TS) is too generic to be patented/copyrighted.

Therefore, a possible approach might be to use the same compression(s) SHP(TS) uses and just use different file and frame headers.
For the file header, we could replace the always-zero uint16 at the start with some other value (or a string, maybe `ORASHP`).
For frame headers, compared to SHP(TS) we could simply throw out the (unused) 3-byte-align, the following uint32 RGBA radar color (not used by OpenRA), and the following uint32 (unused).

That way, it should be easy to add support for this format to OS SHP Builder and XCC Mixer (though at least some command-line encoder will be needed for platforms on which these don't run, of course).
A minor additional benefit would be that total filesize would decrease by 11 bytes per frame due to the slimmed down frame header (which could save about 6 KB per TS infantry shp with e1 sequences, for example) as a little extra benefit.

This should avoid any hypothetical problems with the proprietary nature of Westwood-developed SHP formats.

data.title: Engineer can repair enemy building.
data.body:
STEPS TO REPRODUCE:
1)Capture an oil derrick
2)Have it damaged a little bit somehow
3)Have the derrick captured by a enemy player (The derrick should go underneath the fog of war)
4)Select a engineer and try to tell them to capture the derrick, it will give the repair option
5)Capture option will be restored once the derrick is revealed, but it you use the repair command and don't re-issue commands to the engineer they will just repair it.

I say oil derrick because that's what happened to me, but I bet it would work with any building.

data.title: Improved ProductionParadrop plane targeting
data.body:
Fixes issues with ProductionParadrop by making the producer actor the target instead of it's location when production is finished. This allows it to handle mobile actors far better. Only trading off somewhat questionable logic involving aligning the plane with the exit location.

Fixes the primary issue raised in #11503.

EDIT: As pchote pointed out. The exit really needs to be taken into proper account instead of how it's handled here.

data.title: ProductionParadrop issues
data.body: I just tried using this trait with a moving unit and even with a deployable version there would be issues. Primarily, the unit spawns where the producer currently is instead of where the play flies over which is where ever the producer was when it finished production. If I made it into a deployable version, basically where it deploys into the factory, you run into the issue of having a crash (most likely, I didn't actually test this) when the trait tries to access where the factory when it's been undeployed. It would be referencing a null actor.

data.body:
#10775 rebased and with some small variable naming tweaks.

Fixes #11345.

data.title: Fixed sprite offsets of several Tiberian Sun buildings
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11477.

data.title: Merged PoisonedByTiberium and DamagedWithoutFoundations into DamagedByTerrain
data.body: This allows veins to damage buildings. Closes #9690.

data.title: Move carryall code to Mods.Common.
data.body: In preparation for user-controllable carryalls.  This is done now to improve the readability of the next pr â€“ git otherwise detects those changes as unrelated file deletions and additions.

data.title: Add functionality requested for Shattered Paradise
data.body:
Closes #10978.

//cc @ABrandau.

data.title: ProvidesPrerequisiteFromAllies
data.body:
Inspired by [0AD](http://www.play0ad.com)'s [planned feature](https://github.com/0ad/0ad/blob/92bb12a56552429476bd6e2955cc6cf53e4cb51c/binaries/data/mods/public/simulation/data/civs/spart.json#L81-L85) (which will go by the name `Peloponnesian League` for their Spartan faction's "team bonus").

This allows providing a prereq to a player based of the faction of allied players.

data.title: Thief can steal invulnerable vehicles.
data.body: Seems like an obvious oversight to me.

data.title: Custom Resolutions or Pixel Quadrupling
data.body:
Sorry if this is a double post, but I only found topics regarding the display resolution associated with the UI. Can we get an option for pixel quadrupling or custom resolutions that are not dependent on the systems resolution? 

For example I run on a 4k environment and even with pixel doubling I'm only down to 1080p which is still quite tricky to handle when playing online. Some people of my stream also wondered why we have to adjust the system resolutions everytime we start the game for the wanted resolution.

Is this a thing that could be done, or is there a relevant ticket allready?

data.body:
As i said in tile. I was Allies and, enemy was Soviet. I killed his MCV repaired it with mechanic but it still provides Allied Structures for me.

I also tested hijacking them for comparasion it works fine. I still get MCVs old owner's building after hijacking.

data.title: minimap displayes ore disappearing even under fog of war
data.body:
Tested with: version 2016-05-08 RA mod

Start skirmish map and reveal some terrain with ore on it. Build radar so that minimap appears. If the ore is being mined by another player (with the terrain is still covered under the fog of war) the ore symbols disappears on the minimap. The map itself correctly displayes the last known information (ore being present) but the minimap errorly shows the current state of ore (ore being absent). The minimap should display last known information about the ore.

data.title: Replace actor overscan with checking for HitShapes directly
data.body:
```
[22:34] <reaperrr> pchote: wrt footprint-shaped building hitshapes, in hindsight the default TargetExtraSearchRadius was really too low
[22:34] <reaperrr> I'll have to change every(!) SpreadDamageWH and projectile in all 4 mods if we don't change the default value :x
[22:35] <+pchote> it would make more sense to change the spatial queries to account for hitshapes
(...)
[22:36] <+pchote> select based on the actual size, not just the center point
[22:36] <+pchote> the TargetExtraSearchRadius hack can then go away completely
[22:36] <+pchote> of course, there are tradeoffs in doing that
```

data.title: Improve Rectangle HitShape customizability
data.body:
As temporary solution until someone adds a more customizable PolygonShape, I've added support for 
- applying the shape to all `TargetablePositions` (effectively implementing footprint shapes)
- rotating the shape by 90 degree (necessary for isometric perspective)

As example for the rotation, I'm using this to give TS walls an isometric, rectangular hitshape.

If you need a testcase for the functionality of applying the shape to all `TargetablePositions`, you can find that here: https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/hitshape-test

data.title: Remove LobbyDefaults from reservedModuleNames in Manifest.cs
data.body: It seems like LobbyDefaults was removed as part of #10839.

data.title: Fix blank video heuristic for legacy map import to include upper-case 'X'
data.body:
Fixes #11472.

There are actually seven instances of an upper-case X being used (vs. 66 lower-case ones).

data.title: Added burning trees to the Tiberian Sun mod
data.body:
A new attempt after the feedback from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11405.

Closes #11484.

data.title: Added support power speech notifications
data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11107 and fixes up the surroundings.

data.title: Rework zip updating
data.body: Fixes #11203.

data.title: Mix files can't be loaded from inside oramods
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/FileSystem/MixFile.cs#L195 assumes/requires that the mix file lives on disk, and crashes when it discovers that it was loaded from a `MemoryStream` instead of a `FileStream`.
